climbs.name: Watti-Yatti
climbs.fa: Anderson, Arnold, Jones, Jones, Yasmer, and Jobst in 1991

content.description: Bolted slab climbing finishes on a featured head wall. Good movement and protection with either a smeary direct boulder start (5.10d) or a sidle in from the right to keep the grade as listed.
content.protection: 7 bolts, 2 bolt anchor shared with Five Reliable Sisters.

climbs.name: Five Reliable Sisters
climbs.fa: Jim Arnold, Steve Yasmer, and Chuck Jobst in 1991

content.description: Low angle hand crack fun leads to a steeper head wall. The climbing leads to a shared anchor with Watti-Yatti.
content.protection: 1" - 4" cams should do it, two bolt anchor shared with Watti-Yatti.
content.location: The obvious crack just right of the bolt line.

content.description:
The crack begins as a diagonal double crack  from left to right (fingers).  Gain a small hole to rest in an undercling and prepare for the strenuous crux.  The crux is the obvious but short left facing dihedral.  It starts at off fingers and pinches down.

Pull over the lip onto a dirty ledge and sling a perched boulder on the left.  Pull around the left side of the boulder and up to a small old tree.

Boulders form a right facing corner to the top.

The anchors are just to the left of the top out.
content.protection: standard rack to #2. Bring along some micro cams. I used a green and blue alien cam.  A set of wires could be handy, but not necessary.
content.location:
Approach:

At the Cracker Cliff to the right, and around the corner of the 2 5.10's listed .  Just to the right of a right facing dihedral.
